Employers sometimes ask people applying for jobs for personal information, such as their hobbies and interests comma and whether they are married or single. some people say that this information may be relevant and useful, others disagree.
Discuss both views and give your own opinion.
text: Nowadays, the trend of companies requesting specific personal details from an applicant is increasing. While some believe these particulars are important, others argue that it is an unfair practice. This essay will discuss both sides of the argument and provide a reasonable conclusion based on the discussion.

It is thought that when a person is working in a sector similar to their hobbies and interests, they will be more satisfied and efficient with their work. This will consequently result in a favourable outcome for the employers. For instance, a man applying for the position of a gym trainer will be hired easily if they are fitness enthusiasts as they will attract clients and increase profits for the gym. Some companies request for this information to check if the person applying for the position fits their job profile description

However, it is also important to consider that there can be misuse of such practices resulting in decisions made against the applicant.
